page.title: 09A CATHOLIC FAMILY'S SUNDAY
page.content: The Cafferkeys, with five children under 13, are all born Catholics,who attend Mass every Sunday and Holyday from the age of only 2 weeks. For Mrs.Cafferkey Sunday has always been a special day.The children dress in special clothes, and fast for an hour before Mass.They can hear other children playing outside,but must stay in until Mass-time to keep tidy.Their parents give them money for the church collection, or to light a candle for the sick. After Mass, it is a family day, with Grandma coming to tea, or themselves visiting relations. At times of special need they have family prayers. Mr.& Mrs.Cafferkey remember when Sunday was much harder, with fasting from midnight, and long Masses all in Latin. Even now Mrs.Cafferkey sometimes resents the duties when she is tired.
